data.title: extension-specific setting for format on save
data.body:
Feature Request for the new setting

`
"editor.formatOnSave": true,
`

As user I want to use the new setting not only language-specific (#13547). I want also want to actively set in my workspace settings, which extension should format the content.

Example: I support 2 projects. In one project the required formatting is Javascript Standard format (chenxsan.vscode-standard-format). In my second project the format Javascript Semi Standard (homerjam.vscode-semistandard-format) is used.

data.title: Highlighting in HTML breaks with extra " (double quotes)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- Colour theme: Light+ (default light)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create HTML file with any reference to link e.g. `<link rel="stylesheet" href="main.css">`
2. Add an extra double quote e.g. `<link rel="stylesheet"" href="main.css">`
3. Add some placeholder HTML after this line.
4. See that all the highlighting messes (reverts?) up after the line with extra ".

![vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10956179/19426759/cee4b75a-9486-11e6-845b-4b3d78918447.gif)

No changes in `settings.json` content

data.title: auto align colons in object literals, variables, and equals like WebStorm
'files.associations' doesn't work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1 & earlier
- OS Version: macOS 10.12 & earlier

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Edit user settings:

``` json
{
  "files.associations": {
    "*.vue": "HTML"
  }
}
```
1. Open a `.vue` file

Result: The file is opened as plain text file with no syntax highlighting
Expected: The file is recognised as HTML files

data.title: HTML fast typing (with TAB) stopped working, instead hinting useless [abc] thing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: W10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create HTML document
2. Type div or something like that, it should appear then the tooltip.

Everything was working quite well before the last update. I'm using the extension _HTML Snippets (0.0.17)_ , but now it doesn't puts first the tooltip to just press tab; now I need to scroll down to find it and press tab to get it close automatically.

It is pissing me off.

data.title: Jump to def on references of a given symbol whose def we are in doesn't jump you to def
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.6.1 (1.6.1)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6 (15G31)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a file called "foo.js" with this code inside it:

```
function foo() {
  foo();
}
```
1. Right click on `foo()`, and select "Go To Definition"
2. The editor's cursor is not moved to the line "function foo()," but instead remains on the line with `foo()` . If the foo() call were in another function called bar, it would be.
3. Some digging into the internals reveals that this is because the definition range for foo contains the line we are currently on, and in this case the cursor is left as is and not moved to `function foo()`
4. Why is this a bug, and not desired behavior? Imagine foo had 1000 lines, and we were looking at a call to foo on line 999. The expected behavior here seems like it would be to jump to the first line of the foo definition, not to have a no-op (current behavior).

gif: https://cl.ly/0c3s2d0d3K0b

data.title: Apply format.space setting to more languages
data.body:
I don't thinks it's a bug, but it would be really awesome if we could chose, or extend on which language this setting (format.space) apply.

I was trying to create a custom ident style for C++, but it only seems to apply on:
- php
- javascript
- java
- css

I have to say I'm really sad it doesn't work for C++, because that was exactly what I wanted, and it already work for some others language.

Currently, I can change the editor language to one of those listed, but this is really frustrating, especially for such a "small feature".

Thank you.

data.title: IntelliSense for packages in package.json show the suggestions several times
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1 + 1.7.0-insiders
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write `"{__}"` when `{__}` cursor position.
2. Start typing `mi` then press <kbd>Ctrl+Space</kbd>.
3. Continue to typing `romatch`.
4. `micromatch` package show several times.

![2016-10-17_01-07-35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/19421328/daf5e800-9406-11e6-83e3-e4e73492cbaf.gif)

This is not reproduce if start write without quotes.

data.title: Built-in terminal runs with wrong LANG variable (leads to missing power line symbols in the prompt)
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e) - OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan 10.11.6 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Start up the built in terminal 2. Check the variable LANG: echo $LANG. Value shown (wrong): "de.UTF-8". Correct would be: "de_DE.UTF-8" This wrong environment variable leads to power line symbols in the fish status line ([example](https://github.com/oh-my-fish/theme-bobthefish)) shown as "?". With the following configuration, the terminal works fine ``` javascript "terminal.integrated.shell.osx": "/usr/bin/env", "terminal.integrated.shellArgs.osx": [ "LANG=de_DE.UTF-8", "fish", "-li" ], ``` # Examples ## Example: Defect power line prompt ## Example: Correct power line prompt (with configuration as shown above)

data.title: Support to launch debug adapter from extension
data.body:
Currently a debug adapter is launched by VS Code based on a declarative contribution in the package.json.
We should consider to support that a debug adapter can be launched programmatically from the extension.
